022package com.restfb.scope;
023
024import com.restfb.annotation.GraphAPI;
025
026/**
027 * Please check the permission dependencies
028 * <a href="https://developers.facebook.com/docs/pages/overview-1#permission-dependencies">here</a>
029 */
030public enum FacebookPermissions {
031  /**
032   * Provides access to a subset of items that are part of a person's public profile.
033   * 
034   * A person's public profile refers to the following properties on the user object by default:
035   * <ul>
036   * <li>id</li>
037   * <li>name</li>
038   * <li>first_name</li>
039   * <li>last_name</li>
040   * <li>link</li>
041   * <li>gender</li>
042   * <li>locale</li>
043   * <li>timezone</li>
044   * <li>updated_time</li>
045   * <li>verified</li>
046   * </ul>
047   * 
048   * On the web, public_profile is implied with every request and isn't required, although the best practice is to
049   * declare it. On iOS and Android, you must manually request it as part of your login flow.<br />
050   * <br />
051   * 
052   * gender &amp; locale can only be accessed if:
053   * 
054   * <ul>
055   * <li>The person queried is the person using the app.</li>
056   * <li>The person queried is using the app, and is a friend of the person using the app.</li>
057   * <li>The person queried is using the app, is not a friend of the person using the app, but the app includes either
058   * an app access token or an <code>appsecret_proof</code> argument with the call.</li> <br />
059   * <strong>Review</strong> Your app may use this permission without review from Facebook.
060   */
061  PUBLIC_PROFILE("public_profile", Category.PUBLIC), //
062
063  /**
064   * Provides access to a person's age range.
065   *
066   * <p>
067   * <strong>Review</strong>
068   *
069   * <p>
070   * If your app requests this permission Facebook will have to review how your app uses it.
071   */
072  @GraphAPI(since = "3.0")
073  USER_AGE_RANGE("user_age_range", Category.USER_DATA), //
074
075  /**
076   * Access the date and month of a person's birthday. This may or may not include the person's year of birth, dependent
077   * upon their privacy settings and the access token being used to query this field.
078   *
079   * <p>
080   * Please note most integrations will only need age_range which comes as part of the public_profile permission.
081   *
082   * <p>
083   * <strong>Review</strong>
084   *
085   * <p>
086   * If your app requests this permission Facebook will have to review how your app uses it.
087   */
088  USER_BIRTHDAY("user_birthday", Category.USER_DATA), //
089
090  /**
091   * Provides read-only access to the Events a person is hosting or has RSVP'd to.
092   *
093   * <p>
094   * <strong>Review</strong>
095   *
096   * <p>
097   * If your app requests this permission Facebook will have to review how your app uses it.
098   */
099  USER_EVENTS("user_events", Category.EVENTS_GROUPS_PAGES), //
100
101  /**
102   * Provides access the list of friends that also use your app. These friends can be found on the friends edge on the
103   * user object.
104   *
105   * <p>
106   * In order for a person to show up in one person's friend list, both people must have decided to share their list of
107   * friends with your app and not disabled that permission during login. Also both friends must have been asked for
108   * <code>user_friends</code> during the login process.
109   *
110   * <p>
111   * <strong>Review</strong>
112   *
113   * <p>
114   * Your app may use this permission without review from Facebook.
115   */
116  USER_FRIENDS("user_friends", Category.USER_DATA), //
117
118  /**
119   * Provides access to a person's gender.
120   *
121   * <p>
122   * <strong>Review</strong>
123   *
124   * <p>
125   * If your app requests this permission Facebook will have to review how your app uses it.
126   */
127  @GraphAPI(since = "3.0")
128  USER_GENDER("user_gender", Category.USER_DATA), //
129
130  /**
131   * Provides access to a person's hometown location through the hometown field on the User object. This is set by the
132   * user on the Profile.
133   *
134   * <p>
135   * <strong>Review</strong>
136   *
137   * <p>
138   * If your app requests this permission Facebook will have to review how your app uses it.
139   */
140  USER_HOMETOWN("user_hometown", Category.USER_DATA), //
141
142  /**
143   * Provides access to the list of all Facebook Pages and Open Graph objects that a person has liked. This list is
144   * available through the likes edge on the User object.
145   *
146   * <p>
147   * <strong>Review</strong>
148   *
149   * <p>
150   * If your app requests this permission Facebook will have to review how your app uses it.
151   */
152  USER_LIKES("user_likes", Category.USER_DATA), //
153
154  /**
155   * Provides access to the Facebook profile URL for another user of the app.
156   *
157   * <p>
158   * <strong>Review</strong>
159   *
160   * <p>
161   * If your app requests this permission Facebook will have to review how your app uses it.
162   */
163  @GraphAPI(since = "3.0")
164  USER_LINK("user_link", Category.USER_DATA), //
165
166  /**
167   * Provides access to a person's current city through the location field on the User object. The current city is set
168   * by a person on their Profile.
169   *
170   * <p>
171   * The current city is not necessarily the same as a person's hometown.
172   *
173   * <p>
174   * <strong>Review</strong>
175   *
176   * <p>
177   * If your app requests this permission Facebook will have to review how your app uses it.
178   */
179  USER_LOCATION("user_location", Category.USER_DATA), //
180
181  /**
182   * Enables your app to read the Groups a person is an admin of through the groups edge on the User object.
183   *
184   * <p>
185   * This permission does not allow you to create groups on behalf of a person. It is not possible to create groups via
186   * the Graph API. This does not let you read the groups a user is just a member of.
187   *
188   * <p>
189   * This permission is being deprecated as Groups is moving to a new permission model for apps. Please continue to use
190   * {@code user_managed_groups} for testing your apps in dev mode. However, when submitting for review, please select
191   * the reviewable feature Groups API, and do not submit this {@code user_managed_groups} in your review.
192   *
193   * <p>
194   * <b>Limited use: for testing only</b>
195   */
196  USER_MANAGED_GROUPS("user_managed_groups", Category.EVENTS_GROUPS_PAGES), //
197
198  /**
199   * The user_messenger_contact permission allows a business to contact a person via Messenger upon their approval or
200   * initiation of a chat thread with the business's Page.
201   *
202   * <p>
203   * The allowed usage for this permission is for a Page to send a person an initial message,
204   * post—purchase updates and account updates.
205   *
206   * <strong>Review</strong>
207   *
208   * <p>
209   * If your app requests this permission Facebook will have to review how your app uses it.
210   */
211  USER_MESSENGER_CONTACT("user_messenger_contact", Category.EVENTS_GROUPS_PAGES), //
212
213  /**
214   * Provides access to the photos a person has uploaded or been tagged in. This is available through the photos edge on
215   * the User object.
216   *
217   * <p>
218   * <strong>Review</strong>
219   *
220   * <p>
221   * If your app requests this permission Facebook will have to review how your app uses it.
222   */
223  USER_PHOTOS("user_photos", Category.USER_DATA), //
224
225  /**
226   * Provides access to the posts on a person's Timeline.
227   *
228   * <p>
229   * Includes their own posts, posts they are tagged in, and posts other people make on their Timeline.
230   *
231   * <p>
232   * <strong>Review</strong>
233   *
234   * <p>
235   * If your app requests this permission Facebook will have to review how your app uses it.
236   *
237   * @since 1.10.0
238   */
239  USER_POSTS("user_posts", Category.USER_DATA), //
240
241  /**
242   * Provides access to the Places a person has been tagged at in photos, videos, statuses and links.
243   *
244   * <p>
245   * <strong>Review</strong>
246   *
247   * <p>
248   * If your app requests this permission Facebook will have to review how your app uses it.
249   */
250  USER_TAGGED_PLACES("user_tagged_places", Category.USER_DATA), //
251
252  /**
253   * Provides access to the videos a person has uploaded or been tagged in.
254   *
255   * <p>
256   * <strong>Review</strong>
257   *
258   * <p>
259   * If your app requests this permission Facebook will have to review how your app uses it.
260   */
261  USER_VIDEOS("user_videos", Category.USER_DATA), //
262
263  /**
264   * Provides the ability to both read and manage the ads for ad accounts you have access to. Please see
265   * <a href="https://developers.facebook.com/docs/marketing-api/buying-api">Ads Management</a> for details.
266   */
267  ADS_MANAGEMENT("ads_management", Category.EVENTS_GROUPS_PAGES), //
268
269  /**
270   * Provides the access to <a href="https://developers.facebook.com/docs/marketing-api/read-access-onboarding">Ads
271   * Insights API</a> to pull ads report information for ad accounts you have access to.
272   */
273  ADS_READ("ads_read", Category.EVENTS_GROUPS_PAGES), //
274
275  /**
276   * The attribution_read permission grants your app access to the Attribution API to pull
277   * attribution report data for lines of business you own or have been granted access to by
278   * the owner or owners of other lines of business.
279   *
280   * Allowed Usage
281   *
282   * Provides the ability for your app to access ads performance data from Attribution for
283   * use in custom dashboards and data analytics.
284   */
285  ATTRIBUTION_READ("attribution_read", Category.EVENTS_GROUPS_PAGES), //
286
287  /**
288   * Provides access to the person's primary email address via the email property on the user object.
289   *
290   * <p>
291   * Do not spam users. Your use of email must comply with both Facebook policies and with the CAN-SPAM Act.
292   *
293   * <p>
294   * Note, even if you request the email permission it is not guaranteed you will get an email address. For example, if
295   * someone signed up for Facebook with a phone number instead of an email address, the email field may be empty.
296   *
297   * <p>
298   * <strong>Review</strong>
299   *
300   * <p>
301   * Your app may use this permission without review from Facebook.
302   */
303  EMAIL("email", Category.USER_DATA), //
304
305  /**
306   * The page_events permissions allows your app permission to log events on behalf of
307   * Facebook Pages administered by people using your app and to send those events to
308   * Facebook for ads targeting, optimization and reporting.
309   *
310   * <b>Allowed Usage</b>
311   *
312   * Send businesses related activities (for example purchase, add-to-cart, lead) on behalf
313   * of Pages owned by the people who use your app.
314   */
315  PAGES_EVENTS("pages_events", Category.EVENTS_GROUPS_PAGES), //
316
317  /**
318   * The {@code pages_manage_ads} permission allows your app the ability to manage ads associated with the Page.
319   * 
320   * <p>
321   * You can use this permission to create and manage ads for the Page.
322   *
323   * <p>
324   * <strong>Review</strong>
325   *
326   * <p>
327   * If your app requests this permission Facebook will have to review how your app uses it.
328   *
329   * @since June 1, 2020
330   */
331  PAGES_MANAGE_ADS("pages_manage_ads", Category.EVENTS_GROUPS_PAGES), //
332
333  /**
334   * The {@code pages_manage_metadata} permission allows you to subscribe and receive webhooks about activity on the
335   * Page, and to update settings on the Page.
336   * 
337   * <p>
338   * You can use this permission if you need it to help the Page Admin administer and manage the Page.
339   *
340   * <p>
341   * <strong>Review</strong>
342   *
343   * <p>
344   * If your app requests this permission Facebook will have to review how your app uses it.
345   *
346   * @since June 1, 2020
347   */
348  PAGES_MANAGE_METADATA("pages_manage_metadata", Category.EVENTS_GROUPS_PAGES), //
349
350  /**
351   * The {@code pages_read_engagement} permission allows your app the ability to read content (posts, photos, videos,
352   * events) posted by the Page, read followers data including name, PSID, and profile picture, and read metadata and
353   * other insights about the Page.
354   * 
355   * <p>
356   * You can use this permission if you need it to help the Page Admin administer and manage the Page.
357   *
358   * <p>
359   * <strong>Review</strong>
360   *
361   * <p>
362   * If your app requests this permission Facebook will have to review how your app uses it.
363   *
364   * @since June 1, 2020
365   */
366  PAGES_READ_ENGAGEMENT("pages_read_engagement", Category.EVENTS_GROUPS_PAGES), //
367
368  /**
369   * The {@code pages_read_user_content} permission allows your app the ability to read User generated content on the
370   * Page, such as posts, comments, and ratings by Users or other Pages, and to delete User comments on Page posts.
371   *
372   * <p>
373   * It also allows your app to read posts that the Page is tagged in.
374   *
375   * <p>
376   * You can use this permission to read Users and other Page’s content posted on the Page if you need it to help manage
377   * the Page.
378   *
379   * <p>
380   * <strong>Review</strong>
381   *
382   * <p>
383   * If your app requests this permission Facebook will have to review how your app uses it.
384   *
385   * @since June 1, 2020
386   */
387  PAGES_READ_USER_CONTENT("pages_read_user_content", Category.EVENTS_GROUPS_PAGES), //
388
389  /**
390   * Provides the access to manage call to actions of the Pages that you manage.
391   *
392   * <p>
393   * <strong>Review</strong>
394   *
395   * <p>
396   * If your app requests this permission Facebook will have to review how your app uses it.
397   */
398  @GraphAPI(since = "2.5")
399  PAGES_MANAGE_CTA("pages_manage_cta", Category.EVENTS_GROUPS_PAGES), //
400
401  /**
402   * Lets your app manage Instant Articles on behalf of Facebook Pages administered by people using your app.
403   *
404   * <p>
405   * <strong>Review</strong>
406   *
407   * <p>
408   * If your app requests this permission Facebook will have to review how your app uses it.
409   */
410  @GraphAPI(since = "2.5")
411  PAGES_MANAGE_INSTANT_ARTICLES("pages_manage_instant_articles", Category.EVENTS_GROUPS_PAGES), //
412
413  /**
414   * Provides access to manage leads retrieved from Lead Ads of the Pages that you manage.
415   *
416   * <p>
417   * <strong>Review</strong>
418   *
419   * <p>
420   * If your app requests this permission Facebook will have to review how your app uses it.
421   */
422  @GraphAPI(since = "2.3")
423  PAGES_MANAGE_LEADS("pages_manage_leads", Category.EVENTS_GROUPS_PAGES), //
424
425  /**
426   * This allows you to send and receive messages through a Facebook Page.
427   *
428   * <p>
429   * This permission cannot be used to send promotional or advertising content. Conversations through this API can only
430   * begin when someone indicates—through a Messenger plugin or directly messaging you—that they want to receive
431   * messages from you.
432   *
433   * <p>
434   * <strong>Review</strong>
435   *
436   * <p>
437   * If your app requests this permission Facebook will have to review how your app uses it.
438   */
439  @GraphAPI(since = "2.6")
440  PAGES_MESSAGING("pages_messaging", Category.MESSAGING), //
441
442  /**
443   * This allows you to send and receive messages through a Facebook Page.
444   *
445   * <p>
446   * This permission cannot be used to send promotional or advertising content. Conversations through this API can only
447   * begin when someone indicates—through a Messenger plugin or directly messaging you—that they want to receive
448   * messages from you.
449   *
450   * <p>
451   * <strong>Review</strong>
452   *
453   * <p>
454   * If your app requests this permission Facebook will have to review how your app uses it.
455   */
456  @GraphAPI(since = "2.6")
457  PAGES_MESSAGING_PHONE_NUMBER("pages_messaging_phone_number", Category.MESSAGING), //
458
459  /**
460   * Provides the access to show the list of the Pages that you manage.
461   *
462   * <p>
463   * <strong>Review</strong>
464   *
465   * <p>
466   * If your app requests this permission Facebook will have to review how your app uses it.
467   */
468  @GraphAPI(since = "2.5")
469  PAGES_SHOW_LIST("pages_show_list", Category.EVENTS_GROUPS_PAGES), //
470
471  /**
472   * The pages_user_gender permission allows your app to access a user's gender through the
473   * Page your app is connected to.
474   *
475   * Allowed Usage
476   *
477   * <ul>
478   *   <li>Personalize experiences or recommendations based on gender.</li>
479   *   <li>Use gendered language such as correct pronouns and titles.</li>
480   * </ul>
481   */
482  PAGES_USER_GENDER("pages_user_gender", Category.EVENTS_GROUPS_PAGES), //
483
484  /**
485   * The pages_user_locale permission allows your to app to a user's locale through the Page your app is connected to.
486   *
487   * Allowed Usage
488   *
489   * <ul>
490   * <li>Personalize experiences based on the locale of a person by surfacing locale specific content.</li>
491   * <li>Send responses in the preferred language of the person.</li>
492   * <li>Display numbers, times, and dates correctly for the locale of the person.</li>
493   * </ul>
494   */
495  PAGES_USER_LOCALE("pages_user_locale", Category.EVENTS_GROUPS_PAGES), //
496
497  /**
498   * The pages_user_timezone permission grants your app access to a user's time zone
499   * through the Page your app is connected to.
500   *
501   * Allowed Usage
502   *
503   * <ul>
504   * <li>Prevent messages from being sent at an inconvenient time.</li>
505   * <li>Send time sensitive content or recurring news at a specific time.</li>
506   * <li>Provide tailored content based on time.</li>
507   * <li>Send time appropriate greetings.</li>
508   * </ul>
509   */
510  PAGES_USER_TIMEZONE("pages_user_timezone", Category.EVENTS_GROUPS_PAGES), //
511
512  /**
513   * The {@code pages_manage_posts} permission allows your app the ability to create, edit, and delete your Page posts.
514   *
515   * <p>
516   * If you have access to {@code pages_read_user_content}, you can also use {@code pages_manage_posts} to delete Page
517   * posts created by a User.
518   *
519   * <p>
520   * You can use this permission to create and delete content on the Page.
521   *
522   * <p>
523   * <strong>Review</strong>
524   *
525   * <p>
526   * If your app requests this permission Facebook will have to review how your app uses it.
527   *
528   * @since June 1, 2020
529   */
530  PAGES_MANAGE_POSTS("pages_manage_posts", Category.EVENTS_GROUPS_PAGES), //
531
532  /**
533   * The {@code pages_manage_engagement} permission allows your app the ability to create, edit, and delete comments
534   * posted on the Page.
535   *
536   * <p>
537   * If you have access to {@code pages_read_user_content}, you can also use {@code pages_manage_engagement} to delete
538   * comments posted by other Pages.
539   *
540   * <p>
541   * It also allows your app the ability to create and delete your own Page's likes to Page content.
542   *
543   * <p>
544   * You can use this permission if you need it to help manage and moderate content on the Page.
545   *
546   * <p>
547   * <strong>Review</strong>
548   *
549   * <p>
550   * If your app requests this permission Facebook will have to review how your app uses it.
551   *
552   * @since June 1, 2020
553   */
554  PAGES_MANAGE_ENGAGEMENT("pages_manage_engagement", Category.EVENTS_GROUPS_PAGES), //
555
556  /**
557   * Gives an app the ability to post content into a group on behalf of a user who has granted the app this permission.
558   *
559   * <p>
560   * <strong>Review</strong>
561   *
562   * <p>
563   * If your app requests this permission Facebook will have to review how your app uses it.
564   */
565  @GraphAPI(since = "3.0")
566  PUBLISH_TO_GROUPS("publish_to_groups", Category.EVENTS_GROUPS_PAGES), //
567
568  /**
569   * Grants an app permission to publish live videos to the app User's timeline.
570   *
571   * <p>
572   * <strong>Review</strong>
573   *
574   * <p>
575   * If your app requests this permission Facebook will have to review how your app uses it.
576   */
577  @GraphAPI(since = "3.1")
578  PUBLISH_VIDEO("publish_video", Category.LIVE_VIDEO), //
579
580  /**
581   * Gives your app the ability to receive member-related data on group content when a member has granted the app
582   * permission to do so.
583   *
584   * <p>
585   * <strong>Review</strong>
586   *
587   * <p>
588   * If your app requests this permission Facebook will have to review how your app uses it.
589   */
590  @GraphAPI(since = "3.0")
591  GROUPS_ACCESS_MEMBER_INFO("groups_access_member_info", Category.EVENTS_GROUPS_PAGES), //
592
593  /**
594   * Provides read-only access to the Audience Network Insights data for Apps the person owns.
595   *
596   * <p>
597   * <strong>Review</strong>
598   *
599   * <p>
600   * If your app requests this permission Facebook will have to review how your app uses it.
601   */
602  @GraphAPI(since = "2.4")
603  READ_AUDIENCE_NETWORK_INSIGHTS("read_audience_network_insights", Category.OTHER), //
604
605  /**
606   * The research_apis permission allows your app to access data on public Facebook
607   * Pages, Groups, and Events within the Facebook Open Research and Transparency Tool.
608   *
609   * Allowed Usage
610   *
611   * Utilize public Facebook data for academic research.
612   */
613  RESEARCH_APIS("research_apis", Category.OTHER), //
614
615  /**
616   *
617   * <p>
618   * <strong>Review</strong>
619   *
620   * <p>
621   * If your app requests this permission Facebook will have to review how your app uses it.
622   */
623  READ_INSIGHTS("read_insights", Category.OTHER), //
624
625  /**
626   * Provides the ability to set a person's attendee status on Facebook Events (eg attending, maybe, or declined).
627   *
628   * <p>
629   * This permission does not let you invite people to an event.
630   *
631   * <p>
632   * This permission does not let you update an event's details.
633   *
634   * <p>
635   * This permission does not let you create an event. There is no way to create an event via the API as of Graph API
636   * v2.0.
637   *
638   * <p>
639   * <strong>Review</strong>
640   *
641   * <p>
642   * If your app requests this permission Facebook will have to review how your app uses it.
643   */
644  RSVP_EVENT("rsvp_event", Category.EVENTS_GROUPS_PAGES), //
645
646  /**
647   * Read and write with Business Management API
648   *
649   * <p>
650   * <strong>Review</strong>
651   *
652   * <p>
653   * If your app requests this permission Facebook will have to review how your app uses it.
654   */
655  BUSINESS_MANAGEMENT("business_management", Category.EVENTS_GROUPS_PAGES), //
656
657  /**
658   * Grants your app the ability to create, read, update, and delete business owned product catalogs that the user is an
659   * admin of. This permission grants access to related endpoints. By default, your app may only access product catalogs
660   * that are owned by admins of the app when in developer mode.
661   * 
662   * <p>
663   * <strong>Review</strong>
664   * 
665   * <p>
666   * If your app requests this permission Facebook will have to review how your app uses it.
667   */
668  CATALOG_MANAGEMENT("catalog_management", Category.EVENTS_GROUPS_PAGES), //
669
670  /**
671   * The gaming_user_locale permission allows your app to get a user's preferred language
672   * while the user plays a game on Facebook (for example, Instant Games or Cloud Gaming).
673   *
674   * Allowed Usage
675   *
676   * Display a game interface in the user's preferred language.
677   */
678  GAMING_USER_LOCALE("gaming_user_locale", Category.EVENTS_GROUPS_PAGES), //
679
680  /**
681   * Grants your app permission to retrieve all the information captured within a
682   * <a href="https://developers.facebook.com/docs/marketing-api/guides/lead-ads/">lead.</a>
683   *
684   * <p>
685   * <strong>Review</strong>
686   *
687   * <p>
688   * If your app requests this permission Facebook will have to review how your app uses it.
689   */
690  @GraphAPI(since = "3.1")
691  LEADS_RETRIEVAL("leads_retrieval", Category.EVENTS_GROUPS_PAGES), //
692
693  /**
694   * This allows you to send and receive messages through a Facebook Page out of the 24h window opened by a user action.
695   *
696   * <p>
697   * This permission cannot be used to send promotional or advertising content.
698   *
699   * <p>
700   * <strong>Review</strong>
701   *
702   * <p>
703   * If your app requests this permission Facebook will have to review how your app uses it.
704   */
705  @GraphAPI(since = "2.6")
706  PAGES_MESSAGING_SUBSCRIPTIONS("pages_messaging_subscriptions", Category.MESSAGING), //
707
708  /**
709   * This allows you to charge users in Messenger conversations on behalf of pages.
710   *
711   * <p>
712   * Intended for tangible goods only, not virtual or subscriptions.
713   *
714   * <p>
715   * <strong>Review</strong>
716   *
717   * <p>
718   * If your app requests this permission Facebook will have to review how your app uses it.
719   */
720  @GraphAPI(since = "2.6")
721  PAGES_MESSAGING_PAYMENTS("pages_messaging_payments", Category.MESSAGING),
722

825  INSTAGRAM_GRAPH_USER_PROFILE("instagram_graph_user_profile", Category.INSTAGRAM), //
826
827  /**
828   * Provides the ability to read and/or manage WhatsApp business assets you own or have been granted access to by other
829   * businesses through this permission.
830   *
831   * These business assets include WhatsApp business accounts, phone numbers, and message templates.
832   *
833   * <p>
834   * Please see <a href=
835   * "https://developers.facebook.com/docs/facebook-login/permissions/#reference-whatsapp_business_management">Whatsapps's
836   * reference</a> for details.
837   *
838   * <p>
839   * <strong>Review</strong>
840   *
841   * <p>
842   * If your app requests this permission Facebook will have to review how your app uses it.
843   */
844  WHATSAPP_BUSINESS_MANAGEMENT("whatsapp_business_management", Category.WHATSAPP),
845
846  /**
847   * The `whatsapp_business_messaging` permission allows an app to send WhatsApp messages to a specific phone number,
848   * upload and retrieve media from messages, manage and get WhatsApp business profile information,
849   * and to register those phone numbers with Meta.
850   *
851   * <p>
852   * Please see <a href=
853   * "https://developers.facebook.com/docs/permissions/reference/whatsapp_business_messaging">Whatsapps's
854   * reference</a> for details.
855   *
856   * <p>
857   * <strong>Review</strong>
858   *
859   * <p>
860   * If your app requests this permission Facebook will have to review how your app uses it.
861   */
862  WHATSAPP_BUSINESS_MESSAGING("whatsapp_business_messaging", Category.WHATSAPP);
863
864  private final String permissionString;
865
866  private final Category category;
867
868  FacebookPermissions(String facebookPermissionString, Category category) {
869    this.permissionString = facebookPermissionString;
870    this.category = category;
871  }
872
873  public String getPermissionString() {
874    return this.permissionString;
875  }
876
877  public Category getCategory() {
878    return this.category;
879  }
880
881  public enum Category {
882    PUBLIC, USER_DATA, EVENTS_GROUPS_PAGES, OTHER, MESSAGING, INSTAGRAM, LIVE_VIDEO, WHATSAPP
883  }
884}
